bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, February 3, 1949

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that the Walter Reed Memorial Association has approved increasing the monthly payments made to Emilie Lawrence Reed.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, February 3, 1949
div1.opener:
2220 - 20th Street., N. W.,
Washington 9, D. C.,
February 3, 1949.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
At the annual meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association
on November 15, 1948, a resolution was passed authorizing the
Treasurer of the Association to increase the monthly payments to
Mrs. Emily L. Reed $50.00 per month beginning December 1, 1948.

The intention of the Board of Managers was that this additional
compensation to Mrs. Reed begin on the above-mentioned date but due
to the accounting system used by the American Security and Trust
Company the payment authorized would not begin until December 23,
1948, and in order to correct this I have changed the wording of
the resolution to read as follows:

RESOLVED, That the Treasurer of this Association be, and he
hereby is, authorized to increase the monthly payments to Mrs. Emily L.
Reed fifty dollars ($50.00) per month, beginning November 1, 1948,
and continuing for not more than twelve months; * * *

Other than the changing of the date of the beginning of these
payments the resolution remains the same as written.

It is requested that you attach this letter to your copy of the
minutes of the annual meeting or that you correct the minutes as
indicated above.

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler, Col., U.S.A., Retired
Secretary, Walter Reed Memorial
Association
